page.title: 17Station Yard's Industries
page.content: {The Station Yard}was the site of the Malmesbury Railway Station until 1962. There are 4 factories on the site now. {Lux Traffic Controls,}originally a Tetbury company,moved here in 1974.It employs 45 people who make traffic lights.These lights are hired out from their Easton Grey office within a 40 mile radius.{Ranalagh Gates}has been in Malmesbury for 16 years.It employs 33 people who make about 46,000 gates p.a.The gates are sold direct to shops {Sweetnam and Bradley},a Malmesbury firm,are sheet metalwork specialists. They have been at Station Yard for 14 years and employ 35 people.They sell their finished products to other firms {X_o_graph}has been on its present site for 1 year.Ten people work there,most of whom live in Chippenham. They make x_ray equipment.They send their goods to British and foreign hospitals.
